Clark I Anderson wrote:
> 
> Thank you.
> 
> The error message still happens.
> 
> I have made the changes to the Eclipse ClassPath
> 
> Eclipse
>   Windows
>     Preferences
>       Java
>         BuildPath
>           ClassPath
> added:
> HTTPJS_JAR=D:/JAVADevEnv/Tools/HTTPUnit/httpunit-1.6/jars/js.jar

You're adding to the Eclipse class path, and not the Ant class path.

Here's what you should do:

1. Start a command line.
2. SET CLASSPATH=
(That's nothing on the right side of the equal sign.)
3. Get your Ant build to work by adding items using the <classpath> 
element of the various tasks.

At the end of this, you'll have an Ant build that doesn't rely on global 
environment variables, which will work no matter from where you execute 
it, including Eclipse.

> There should not be any problem with the URL = File , should there?

What do you mean here?
